definition: to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex

sentences.english: The clouds lingering over the mountainside and the fog often surround us.
sentences.chinese: 雲霧旋繞在山腰，自己們經常被年夜霧所覆蓋。

sentences.english: Fiery formations swirl around a sunspot on the sun's turbulent surface.
sentences.chinese: 在太陽狂爆表面上，熾熱物質旋繞着一個太陽黑點。

sentences.english: Apply before going to sleep following through the night out in a smoke-filled environment.
sentences.chinese: 要是1晚上都泡在煙霧旋繞的環境，建議睡前使用。

sentences.english: Their songs reverberated through the valley.
sentences.chinese: 他們的歌聲在山谷中旋繞。

sentences.english: Apply forward going to your bed from overnight out in a smoke-filled environment.
sentences.chinese: 假使1早晨都泡在煙霧旋繞的環境，創議睡前使用。

definition: no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
to have no sense of shame/brazen
to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom)/to get one's big break
